io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.controller

Class StockMarketController

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.craigmiller160.mvp.core.AbstractController
      • io.craigmiller160.mvp.listener.AbstractListenerController
        • io.craigmiller160.mvp.concurrent.AbstractConcurrentListenerController
          • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.controller.StockMarketController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener

    @ThreadSafe
public class StockMarketController
extends io.craigmiller160.mvp.concurrent.AbstractConcurrentListenerController
    The controller for the StockMarket program. This class extends AbstractConcurrentListenerController from the MVP Framework, and fully utilizes its concurrency. All events received from the GUI are off-loaded to background threads, where the appropriate task is executed.

    All property names and action commands used throughout this program are constants in this class, allowing them to be managed in a centralized location. All views and models should import these values to ensure consistency across the program.

    As of version 2.2, the DAO for handling database access is not generated inside this class. Rather, it is injected via a setter method. If this setter is not used to set this value at program startup, this controller will be unable to save/load to and from the database.

    THREAD SAFETY: This class is thread safe. All methods invoked by processEvent(String,Object) are properly constructed so that they can be accessed by multiple threads simultaneously.

    Version:
    2.3
    Author:
    craig

    • Constructor Detail

      • StockMarketController

        public StockMarketController()
        Constructs an instance of this controller with no set thread pool size. Threads are created as needed, as many threads as are necessary, and when they're no longer in use they are disposed of.

      • StockMarketController

        public StockMarketController(int threadPoolSize)
        Constructs an instance of this controller with a fixed thread pool size. The exact number of threads specified here are created at initialization. Unless the properties of the thread pool are altered, there will never be more threads than this available during the lifespan of this object, and any threads that die will be replaced.
        Parameters:
        threadPoolSize - the fixed size of the thread pool.

      • StockMarketController

        public StockMarketController(int corePoolSize,
                             int maximumPoolSize,
                             long keepAliveTime,
                             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Constructs an instance of this controller with a much more detailed configuration. The parameters set the minimum number of threads to be available at all times (corePoolSize), the maximum number of threads that could be created (maximumPoolSize), and the time to keep any additional threads beyond the core pool size alive (keepAliveTime, unit).
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the minimum number of threads to be available at all times.
        maximumPoolSize - the maximum number of threads that could be created.
        keepAliveTime - the raw number for the amount of time to keep threads beyond the core pool size alive.
        unit - the unit of time for the keepAliveTime value.

    • Method Detail

      • setPersistService

        public void setPersistService(PortfolioPersistService persistService)
        Set the PortfolioPersistService object for creating, saving, and loading portfolios to and from the database. If this property is not set at the start of the program, the program will be unable to perform persistence operations.
        Parameters:
        persistService - the persistence service for this program.

      • getPersistService

        public PortfolioPersistService getPersistService()
        Get the PortfolioPersistService object currently set in this class.
        Returns:
        the persistence service for this program.

      • buyStock

        public void buyStock(java.lang.Object valueFromView)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Purchase shares of the selected stock, based on the value provided from the view.
        Parameters:
        valueFromView - the quantity of shares purchased.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the valueFromView is not a valid Integer.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the reflective operation cannot find a matching method in a registered model.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the method attempting to be accessed by the reflective operation is not accessible by this class.
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if any other problem occurs while attempting to execute the reflective method.
        java.lang.Exception - if any other kind of exception occurs while reflectively executing the method.
        InsufficientFundsException - if there is not enough cash available to purchase the selected number of shares of the stock.

      • changeStockHistoryInterval

        public void changeStockHistoryInterval(java.lang.Object valueFromView)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Respond to a change in the stock history interval by downloading a new history for the new interval.
        Parameters:
        valueFromView - a value from the view that is the interval to set for the history.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the valueFromView is not a valid Integer.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the value returned when getting the SELECTED_STOCK_PROPERTY is not an instance of Stock.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the reflective operation cannot find a matching method in a registered model.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the method attempting to be accessed by the reflective operation is not accessible by this class.
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if any other problem occurs while attempting to execute the reflective method.
        java.lang.Exception - if any other kind of exception occurs while reflectively executing the method.
        InvalidStockException - if the stock to download data for is not a valid stock.
        java.io.IOException - if the web data is unable to be properly downloaded/parsed.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the server to download the data.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if valueFromView is not a valid String.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the reflective operation cannot find a matching method in a registered model.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the method attempting to be accessed by the reflective operation is not accessible by this class.
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if any other problem occurs while attempting to execute the reflective method.
        java.lang.Exception - if another exception occurs while attempting to execute this operation.
        org.hibernate.HibernateException - if Hibernate is unable to perform the database operation.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while attempting to execute this method.

      • savePortfolio

        public void savePortfolio()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Save the portfolio to the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the reflective operation cannot find a matching method in a registered model.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the method attempting to be accessed by the reflective operation is not accessible by this class.
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if any other problem occurs while attempting to execute the reflective method.
        java.lang.Exception - if another exception occurs while attempting to execute this operation.
        org.hibernate.HibernateException - if Hibernate is unable to perform the database operation.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while attempting to execute this method.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the PortfolioModel isn't found in the list of registered models.
